44 #include <iostream>
45 #include "Xvt.hpp"
46 
47 // Output operator for Xvt
48 // @param os output stream to which \c xvt is sent
49 // @param xvt Xvt that is sent to \c os
50 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const gpstk::Xvt& xvt) throw()
51 {
52  os << "x:" << xvt.x
53  << ", v:" << xvt.v
54  << ", clk bias:" << xvt.clkbias
55  << ", clk drift:" << xvt.clkdrift
56  << ", relcorr:" << xvt.relcorr;
57  return os;
58 }
59 
60 // compute the relativity correction
61 double gpstk::Xvt::computeRelativityCorrection(void)
62 {
63  relcorr = -2.0*( (x[0]/C_MPS)*(v[0]/C_MPS)
64  +(x[1]/C_MPS)*(v[1]/C_MPS)
65  +(x[2]/C_MPS)*(v[2]/C_MPS) );
66  return relcorr;
67 }
68 
69 // Function to find the range and position from a ground
70 // location, rxPos, to the spacecraft position (*this).x
71 // Use the pseudorange corrected for SV clock effects to get a
72 // rough time of flight (dt). Account directly for Earth
73 // rotation, then compute a rough receiver bias by differencing
74 // the initial time of flight with the new estimate. Then
75 // correct the rotation by a small amount.
76 double gpstk::Xvt::preciseRho(const Triple& rxPos,
77  const EllipsoidModel& ellips,
78  double correction) const
79  throw()
80 {
81  // Compute initial time of flight estimate using the
82  // geometric range at transmit time. This fails to account
83  // for the rotation of the earth, but should be good to
84  // within about 40 m
85  double sr1 = rxPos.slantRange(x);
86  double dt = sr1 / ellips.c();
87 
88  // compute rotation angle in the time of signal transit
89  double rotation_angle = -ellips.angVelocity() * dt;
90 
91  // rotate original GS coordinates to new values to correct for
92  // rotation of ECEF frame
93  // Ref: Satellite Geodesy, Gunter Seeber, 1993, pg 291 and the
94  // ICD-GPS-200 sheet 102 May 1993 version
95  // xnew[0]=xg[0]*cos(rotation_angle)-xg[1]*sin(rotation_angle);
96  // xnew[1]=xg[1]*cos(rotation_angle)+xg[0]*sin(rotation_angle);
97  // xnew[2]=xg[2];
98  // since cosine and sine are small, approximate by the first
99  // order terms in an expansion.
100  gpstk::Triple xnew;
101  for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
102  {
103  xnew[0] = x[0] - x[1] * rotation_angle;
104  xnew[1] = x[1] + x[0] * rotation_angle;
105  xnew[2] = x[2];
106 
107  // Compute geometric slant range from ground station to
108  // the rotated new coord's
109  sr1 = rxPos.slantRange(xnew);
110 
111  // Recompute the time of flight (dt) based on PR, with the
112  // time of flight based on geometric range. Note that
113  // this is a really unneeded, in that the change in PR is
114  // < 40 m, hence the change in tof is < 20 ns
115  dt = sr1 / ellips.c();
116 
117  // Compute new rotation in this time
118  rotation_angle = -ellips.angVelocity() * dt;
119  }
120 
121  // Account for SV clock drift, relativity and user input correction
122  double rho = sr1 - (clkbias + relcorr) * ellips.c() - correction;
123 
124  return rho;
125 
126 } // end of preciseRho()
